org.threadly.concurrent.limiter

Class SimpleSchedulerLimiter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.concurrent.AbstractSubmitterExecutor
      • org.threadly.concurrent.limiter.ExecutorLimiter
        • org.threadly.concurrent.limiter.SubmitterSchedulerLimiter
          • org.threadly.concurrent.limiter.SimpleSchedulerLimiter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Executor, SimpleSchedulerInterface, SubmitterExecutor, SubmitterExecutorInterface, SubmitterScheduler, SubmitterSchedulerInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SchedulerServiceLimiter
    Deprecated. 
    Use SubmitterSchedulerLimiter

    @Deprecated
public class SimpleSchedulerLimiter
extends SubmitterSchedulerLimiter
implements SubmitterSchedulerInterface

    This class is designed to limit how much parallel execution happens on a provided SimpleSchedulerInterface. This allows the implementor to have one thread pool for all their code, and if they want certain sections to have less levels of parallelism (possibly because those those sections would completely consume the global pool), they can wrap the executor in this class.

    Thus providing you better control on the absolute thread count and how much parallelism can occur in different sections of the program.

    This is an alternative from having to create multiple thread pools. By using this you also are able to accomplish more efficiently thread use than multiple thread pools would.

    Since:
    2.0.0

      • SimpleSchedulerLimiter

        public SimpleSchedulerLimiter(SimpleSchedulerInterface scheduler,
                              int maxConcurrency,
                              java.lang.String subPoolName)
        Deprecated. 
        Constructs a new limiter that implements the SimpleSchedulerInterface.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - SimpleSchedulerInterface implementation to submit task executions to.
        maxConcurrency - maximum quantity of runnables to run in parallel
        subPoolName - name to describe threads while tasks running in pool (null to not change thread names)
